CryptoKey.summary: The CryptoKey interface of the Web Crypto API represents a cryptographic {{glossary("key")}} obtained from one of the methods , , , or .

remarks.para: For security reasons, the CryptoKey interface can only be used in a secure context.

-Web Crypto API
-Web security
-Privacy, permissions, and information security
- and .

CryptoKeyAlgorithm.summary: The read-only algorithm property of the interface returns an object describing the algorithm for which this key can be used, and any associated extra parameters.

remarks.para: The object returned depends of the algorithm used to generate the key.

CryptoKeyAlgorithm.value: An object matching:For RsaHashedKeyGenParams and HmacKeyGenParams, the hash property is always in the object form (with a property called name), not the string form.

CryptoKeyExtractable.summary: The read-only extractable property of the interface indicates whether or not the key may be extracted using SubtleCrypto.exportKey() or SubtleCrypto.wrapKey().

remarks.para: If the key cannot be exported, exportKey() or wrapKey() will throw an exception if used to extract it.

CryptoKeyExtractable.value: A boolean value that is true if the key can be exported and false if not.

CryptoKeyType.summary: The read-only type property of the interface indicates which kind of key is represented by the object. It can have the following values:
CryptoKeyType.value: One of the following strings: "secret", "private", or "public".

CryptoKeyUsages.summary: The read-only usages property of the interface indicates what can be done with the key.
CryptoKeyUsages.value: An of strings from the following list:
